title: Public transport for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup: Sunday 16 October, Tuesday 18 October and Thursday 20 October 2022
articleContent:
Public transport for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup: Sunday 16 October, Tuesday 18 October and Thursday 20 October 2022

Extra public transport services are running to and from ICC Men’s T20 World Cup games at Kardinia Park (GMHBA Stadium) on Sunday 16 October, Tuesday 18 October and Thursday 20 October 2022.

Game day start time:

  • Sunday 16 October – Sri Lanka v Namibia 3pm start and UAE v Netherlands 7pm start
  • Tuesday 18 October – Namibia v Netherlands 3pm start and Sri Lanka v UAE 7pm start
  • Thursday 20 October -  Sri Lanka v UAE 3pm start and Namibia v Netherlands 7pm start

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Regional train

Getting to Kardinia Park (South Geelong)

Sunday 16 October – Sri Lanka v Namibia

Passengers are advised to travel to Southern Cross stations and catch any normal services or special service (list below) to South Geelong.

  • 12:30pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 1:37pm
  • 12:45pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 1:50pm
  • 1:00pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 2:18pm

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

Leaving Kardinia Park (South Geelong)

Passengers are advised to catch any train from South Geelong Station to Southern Cross.

  • 6:35pm departing South Geelong to arrive at Southern Cross 7:37pm
  • 6:47pm departing South Geelong to arrive at Southern Cross 7:58pm

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

Sunday 16 October – UAE v Netherlands

Passengers are advised to travel to Southern Cross stations and catch any normal services or special service (list below) to South Geelong.

  • 5:10pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 6:18pm

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

Leaving Kardinia Park (South Geelong)

Passengers are advised to catch any train from South Geelong Station to Southern Cross.

  • 10:35pm departing South Geelong to arrive at Southern Cross 11:38pm
  • 10:38pm departing South Geelong to arrive at Southern Cross 11:58pm

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

Getting to Kardinia Park (South Geelong)

Tuesday 18 October – Namibia v Netherlands

Passengers are advised to travel to Southern Cross stations and catch any normal services or special service (list below) to South Geelong.

  • 1:08pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 2:12pm
  • 1:13pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 2:22pm
  • 1:30pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 2:38pm

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

Leaving Kardinia Park (South Geelong)

Passengers are advised to catch any train from South Geelong Station to Southern Cross.

  • 6:24pm departing South Geelong to arrive at Southern Cross 7:43pm
  • 6:54pm departing South Geelong to arrive at Southern Cross 8:06pm (with additional capacity provided)

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

Tuesday 18 October – Sri Lanka v UAE

Passengers are advised to travel to Southern Cross stations and catch any normal services or special service (list below) to South Geelong.

  • 5:12pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 6:19pm
  • 5:29pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 6:30pm
  • 5:32pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 6:42pm (with additional capacity provided)

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

Leaving Kardinia Park (South Geelong)

Passengers are advised to catch any train from South Geelong Station to Southern Cross.

  • 10:30pm departing South Geelong to Southern Cross (additional train)
  • 10:42pm departing South Geelong to arrive at Southern Cross 11:45pm
  • 11:00pm departing South Geelong to arrive at Southern Cross 00:12am

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

Getting to Kardinia Park (South Geelong)

Thursday 20 October – Sri Lanka v Netherlands

Passengers are advised to travel to Southern Cross stations and catch any normal services or special service (list below) to South Geelong.

  • 12:30pm Southern Cross to South Geelong (with additional capacity provided)
  • 12:50pm Southern Cross to South Geelong (with additional capacity provided)
  • 1:08pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 2:12pm
  • 1:13pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 2:22pm
  • 1:30pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 2:38pm

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

Leaving Kardinia Park (South Geelong)

Passengers are advised to catch any train from South Geelong Station to Southern Cross.

  • 6:24pm departing South Geelong to arrive at Southern Cross 7:43pm
  • 6:54pm departing South Geelong to arrive at Southern Cross 8:06pm (with additional capacity provided)

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

Thursday 20 October – Namibia v UAE

Passengers are advised to travel to Southern Cross stations and catch any normal services or special service (list below) to South Geelong.

  • 5:12pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 6:19pm
  • 5:29pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 6:30pm
  • 5:32pm departing Southern Cross to arrive at South Geelong 6:42pm (with additional capacity provided)

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

Leaving Kardinia Park (South Geelong)

Passengers are advised to catch any train from South Geelong Station to Southern Cross.

  • 10:42pm departing South Geelong to arrive at Southern Cross 11:45pm
  • 11:00pm departing South Geelong to arrive at Southern Cross 00:12am

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Metropolitan train

Getting to Kardinia Park

Passenger are advised to travel to Southern Cross and change to Regional Train services to South Geelong Station.

Leaving Kardinia Park

When arriving on the South Geelong regional services at Southern Cross Station change to Metropolitan services.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from Kardinia Park

Passengers can catch tram service, alighting at Spencer Street, Collins Street or Bourke Street to catch a regional service at Southern Cross Station.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Regional bus

Getting to and from Kardinia Park

The following bus route travels close to Kardinia Park:

  • Route 1 (please note service may finish prior to the end of the matches)
  • Route 24 (please note service may finish prior to the end of the matches)
  • Route 41 (please note service may finish prior to the end of the matches)
  • Route 42 (please note service may finish prior to the end of the matches)
  • Route 50 (please note service may finish prior to the end of the matches)
  • Route 51 (please note service may finish prior to the end of the matches)
  • Route 55 (please note service may finish prior to the end of the matches)
  • Route 101 (please note service may finish prior to the end of the matches)

Please note that due to road closures Moorabool St during the peak of patron arriving and departing the venue, some of these bus routes maybe diverted.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.
articleDescription: Public transport for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup: Sunday 16 October, Tuesday 18 October and Thursday 20 October 2022
